title: Business Watch
text:
Drive Quarterly Sales

Constellation Brands Inc. on Wednesday posted an increase in sales in its fiscal second quarter, boosted by its beer brands.

The alcoholic-beverages company logged earnings of $1.5 million, which includes restructuring and other one-time costs, down from $512.1 million in the year-earlier period. Net sales after excise taxes were $2.37 billion, a rise from $2.26 billion in the year-ago quarter. Net beer sales for brands grew by 14% to $1.86 billion. Constellation's wine and spirits sales declined 18% to $509.8 million.

-- Matt Grossman

---

KROGER

Holiday Goal Is

To Hire 20,000

Grocery giant Kroger Co. said it aims to add an additional 20,000 workers ahead of the holidays. Kroger, which will be competing with Walmart Inc., Amazon.com Inc. and others for hourly staff in a tight labor market, said it would hold a hiring event next week. The openings include jobs in retail, logistics and the pharmacy, among other roles.

Walmart last week said it plans to hire 150,000 workers ahead of the busy holiday shopping season. Kroger held a similar hiring event in June aimed at adding 10,000 employees.

-- Colin Kellaher

---

HOME DEPOT

Deliveries Through

Walmart Planned

Home Depot Inc. will offer customers in some markets same-day and next-day delivery options through Walmart Inc.'s delivery network.

The program will begin in some cities over the next few weeks and will expand to more places by year-end. Financial terms of the arrangement weren't provided.

The Home Depot orders will be delivered by Walmart's GoLocal delivery network, which the retailer rolled out in late August. The program allows customer-bound deliveries from outside businesses, such as Home Depot, to hitch a ride on Walmart's vehicles.

-- Matt Grossman

---

BURGER KING

Meatless Nuggets

To Be Tested

Burger King agreed to test meatless nuggets from Impossible Foods in three markets and roll out new ghost-pepper chicken nuggets nationwide for a limited time.

The Restaurant Brands International Inc. burger business said it would be the first global quick-service chain to test the plant-based nuggets.

Burger King previously teamed with Impossible Foods in 2019 to offer the Impossible Whopper.

The nuggets will be available next week in Miami, Boston and Des Moines, Iowa.

Burger King said members of its Royal Perks loyalty program will have exclusive access to the ghost-pepper nuggets ahead of next week's rollout.

-- Colin Kellaher

---

BOSTON SCIENTIFIC

Agreement Signed

To Acquire Baylis

Boston Scientific Corp. agreed to buy privately held Baylis Medical Co. for $1.75 billion in a deal that bolsters its position in left-heart procedures.

The Marlborough, Mass., maker of medical devices said Baylis, Mississauga, Ontario, has about 800 employees and expects to generate sales of about $200 million next year. Boston Scientific said the deal adds the radiofrequency NRG and VersaCross transseptal platforms.

-- Colin Kellaher
